author: Monica O’Shea
description: Trump and Albanese are now set to meet on Oct. 20.
title: Relationship With US Strong Despite Delayed Trump Meeting: Assistant Foreign Minister

author: Chandra Philip
description: A student union representative at Montreal’s Concordia University is speaking out over some content in the 2025–2026 Student Union Handbook, including the front cover, which features images of pro-Palestinian protests. Concordia Student Union (CSU) councillor Anastasia Zorchinsky says there are no Canadian flags in the book, but several images of Palestinian ones, and it does […]
title: Concordia Student Raises Question Over Student Union Handbook Featuring Palestinian Protests, No Canadian Flags

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The new campaign will offer science and technology scholarships for foster youth worldwide.
title: First Lady Launches Global Coalition for Children, ‘Fostering the Future Together’

author: Matthew Horwood
description: OTTAWA—Helen Grus, an Ottawa Police detective found guilty of discredible conduct for investigating the COVID-19 vaccination status of the mothers of deceased infants, says she still thinks about the case frequently. “When I sleep, I sleep soundly, but when I am awake, I do think of this every single breathing moment that I’m awake. About […]
title: Ottawa Detective Found Guilty for Examining Child Deaths and COVID Vaccine Thinks About Case ‘Every Waking Moment’

description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Super Typhoon Ragasa, Trump Addresses UN General Assembly, and High-Altitude Bike Expedition

description: The privacy commissioner said targeted ads and content can have a negative impact on children.

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree has announced the Liberal government is moving forward with its gun buyback initiative by launching a pilot program in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia. The minister expressed his support for the program at a Sept. 23 press conference, after doubting it in a private Sept. 21 conversation with an individual the […]
title: Gun Buyback to Launch in Cape Breton, Minister Backs Program After Doubting It in Leaked Audio

author: Noé Chartier
description: U.S. Republican senators and representatives say Canada may face negative repercussions for unilaterally recognizing Palestinian statehood. “Proceeding with recognition will put your country at odds with long-standing U.S. policy and interests and may invite punitive measures in response,” the lawmakers wrote in a Sept. 19 letter addressed to Prime Minister Mark Carney ahead of his […]
title: Republican Lawmakers Warn Canada of Potential ‘Punitive Measures’ for Recognizing Palestinian State

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The designation makes it a crime to support the street gang.
title: US Designates Barrio 18 as Foreign Terrorist Organization, Joining Tren de Aragua, MS-13, Others

description: 'It is unacceptable that the United Nations caves to the Chinese Communist Party's censorship efforts on American soil,' Epoch Times chief editor said.
title: UN Denies Epoch Times Press Access Amid Growing CCP Pressure Campaign on US Soil

author: The Canadian Press
description: Tariff tensions with the United States and a more pressing need to diversify Ontario’s trading partners are prompting the province’s minister responsible for economic development to pick up the already robust pace of trade missions abroad. Vic Fedeli, who Premier Doug Ford has dubbed Ontario’s No. 1 salesperson, is in southeast Asia right now. By […]
title: Ontario Minister Picks up Trade Mission Pace as Tariffs Heighten Need to Diversify

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of the Bank of Canada says the country waited too long to reduce its economic dependence on the United States and is paying the price today. Governor Tiff Macklem was in Saskatoon Tuesday giving a speech about global trade disruption to Saskatchewan business leaders. He warned that U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs have […]
title: Canada Waited Too Long to Diversify Trade From US, BoC Governor Says

description: The president's comments came after he delivered remarks before the U.N. General Assembly.

description: A school teacher and a music instructor from Edmonton have been charged with possessing and accessing child pornography in connection with an investigation by Alberta’s Internet Child Exploitation (ICE) unit. The investigation was launched by the ICE unit of the Alberta Law Enforcement Response Teams after receiving a tip from the RCMP’s National Centre for […]
title: Two Edmonton Teachers Face Charges Over Child Sexual Abuse Materials

author: Tom Ozimek
description: 'I think Ukraine, with the support of the European Union, is in a position to fight and WIN all of Ukraine back in its original form,' Trump wrote.
title: Trump Says Ukraine Can Win Back All Territory Lost to Russia

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The owners of a B.C. ostrich farm subject to a cull order have been told by a Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) official that they must leave by Sept. 23 or face arrest by police. RCMP officers accompanied CFIA staff to Universal Ostrich Farms on the morning of Sept. 22 to execute a warrant. The […]
title: Federal Agency Orders BC Ostrich Farmers to Vacate or Face Arrest by RCMP

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: More than four in five Canadians consider oil and gas an essential component of Canada’s economy but support for this perspective has seen a slight decline since the beginning of this year, a new poll suggests. Eighty-four percent of the 1,034 Canadians surveyed by Nanos from July 31 to Aug. 6 described oil and gas […]
title: 84% of Canadians Say Oil, Gas Important to Canada’s Economy: Poll

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa will spend more than $159 billion on infrastructure projects over the next five years, the Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO) estimates. The Liberal government is expected to spend more than $30 billion each year between fiscal 2025-2026 and 2029-2030, according to a Sept. 18 PBO report on federal infrastructure spending. The PBO’s projected infrastructure spending […]
title: Ottawa Will Spend $159 Billion on Infrastructure Over Next 5 Years: Budget Watchdog

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Under EU’s law, imports of palm oil, coffee, and cocoa would not be allowed into the bloc unless firms proved they were deforestation-free.
title: EU Delays Ban on Imports Linked to Deforestation for 2nd Time

description: At the United Nations, the U.S president said the U.N.'s mass migration and climate agendas are ruining the free and developed countries.

description: Surrey-Cloverdale MLA Elenore Sturko has been expelled from the B.C. Conservative caucus, a move that comes the same day that Leader John Rustad survived his leadership review with 70.66 percent support. Rustad told reporters on Sept.22 he decided to drop Sturko from caucus after learning that he had won the leadership review, citing a need […]
title: BC Conservatives Drop Surrey‑Cloverdale MLA Elenore Sturko From Caucus

description: The ban applies to stores owned by Costco, Sam's Club, and BJ's Wholesale Club. It is one of several restrictions imposed on Iranian diplomats at the U.N.

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada has dropped two legal challenges of United States duties on Canadian softwood lumber. The U.S. has long accused Canada’s softwood lumber sector of violating rules on anti-dumping — flooding a market with cheaper, subsidized products to disrupt a domestic industry. The U.S. Commerce Department announced plans last month to nearly triple duties on Canadian […]
title: Canada Drops 2 Appeals of US Anti-Dumping Duties on Softwood Lumber

author: Andrew Moran
description: Argentinian stocks rallied to start the trading week after the United States committed to supporting Buenos Aires during market upheaval. The S&P MERVAL Index—a benchmark stock market index for Argentina—registered its best single-session performance in six months, increasing by 7.55 percent on Sept. 22. Before the rebound, Argentina’s stock market had been one of the […]
title: Argentina’s Markets Bounce Back After Washington Pledges Support

author: Noé Chartier
description: The Canadian prime minister’s National Security and Intelligence Advisor Nathalie Drouin has met with her Indian counterpart Ajit Doval, saying the two committed to “non-interference.” “We discussed our respective security concerns and committed to non-interference including refraining from transnational repression,” Drouin said in a Sept. 20 statement. “We also agreed on the importance of reciprocal […]
title: Carney and Modi’s National Security Advisers Meet in India as Relations Thaw

author: Conrad Black
description: Commentary President Donald Trump’s recent threat to declare Antifa a terrorist organization is a reasonable and helpful response to the contemporary problem of disorder and excessive violence in urban America. Antifa was founded in 2007 in Portland, Oregon, and is a decentralized group of urban associations sharing the name that is a contraction of the […]
title: Conrad Black: Federal Action Against Antifa Is Long Overdue

description: Copenhagen Airport urged passengers to check the status of flights with their airlines.

description: Vice-Admiral Angus Topshee says the Royal Canadian Navy could end up with submarines supplied by both companies vying for Ottawa’s lucrative sub procurement contract—and there could be advantages to diversifying the fleet. Topshee also says the simplest solution would be to operate 12 submarines from just one supplier, which would ensure all the parts and […]
title: Navy Commander Says Canada Could End up With Subs From Two Different Suppliers

title: Uzbekistan Strikes $8.5 Billion Deal With Boeing to Buy 22 Dreamliners

description: MANILA, Philippines—Thousands of people were evacuated from northern Philippine villages and schools and offices were closed Monday in the archipelago and neighboring Taiwan as one of this year’s strongest typhoons threatened to cause flooding and landslides on its way to southeastern China. Super Typhoon Ragasa had sustained winds of 215 kph (134 mph) with gusts […]

description: Hannah Thomas says she was left with possible permanent eye damage after her arrest at a pro-Palestine rally.

author: The Associated Press
description: MIAMI—People in the Azores archipelago were advised Monday to monitor the progress of Hurricane Gabrielle which is now a Category 4 hurricane in the Atlantic Ocean, the National Hurricane Center said. Gabrielle had maximum sustained winds of 140 mph on Monday afternoon as it skirted to the east-southeast of Bermuda, according to a hurricane center […]
title: Gabrielle Becomes at Category 4 Hurricane and Forecasters Advise Azores to Take Notice

description: Hakyung Lee was accused of killing her children and leaving their bodies in suitcases in a storage unit for 4 years.
title: ‘Bodies in Suitcases’ Mother Found Guilty of Murdering Her Children

author: PA Media
description: Reform UK has defended its use of disputed figures to claim billions of pounds would be saved by its immigration and welfare plans, as it announced it would abolish migrant rights to qualify for indefinite leave to remain (ILR). Party leader Nigel Farage said savings would be “considerably larger” than the £230 billion suggested by […]
title: Reform Defends Claim Immigration and Welfare Proposals Will Save Billions

author: PA Media
description: Passengers at Heathrow could face another day of disruption after a cyber attack affected several major European airports. Terror law watchdog Jonathan Hall KC said it was possible state-sponsored hackers could be behind the attack on Collins Aerospace, which operates check-in and boarding systems. On Monday morning Heathrow said work was continuing to “resolve and […]
title: Work Continues to Recover After Cyber Attack Hit Heathrow and Other Airports

author: PA Media
description: BMW’s UK car finance business has set aside more than £200 million to cover the potential impact of the continued fallout from the car loan mis-selling scandal. It is the latest car firm to reveal the potential cost of the motor finance scandal, with millions of drivers expected to be eligible for compensation claims. The […]
title: BMW Sets Aside More Than £200M for UK Motor Finance Scandal

author: PA Media
description: Gatwick Airport’s £2.2 billion second runway plan has been given the go-ahead by Transport Secretary Heidi Alexander. In the privately-financed project, the West Sussex airport will move its emergency runway 12 metres north, enabling it to be used for departures of narrow-bodied planes such as Airbus A320s and Boeing 737s. This will enable it to […]
title: Gatwick Second Runway Plan Given Go-ahead by Government

author: PA Media
description: Plans are being mooted for an £830 million project off the UK coast that claims to be able to boost the UK’s depleted gas storage capacity by up to 50 percent, it has been revealed. British-Irish energy firm dCarbonX, which is backed by Europe’s largest gas infrastructure operator Snam, is proposing to redevelop the former […]
title: Gas Storage Project Being Eyed to Help Boost UK Capacity by up to 50 Percent

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The fight over Australia’s future pits Hastie’s coal-powered revival against tariffs on China and Labor’s clean energy subsidies.
title: ‘Soulless Cars Made in China’: Hastie Calls for Local Manufacturing Revival

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Conservative Leader John Rustad has passed his leadership review after securing the backing of 70 percent of party members following a months-long leadership review that saw low participation. The results, announced Sept. 22, saw only 1,268 members of the party’s 9,000-strong membership cast ballots, with Rustad winning in 78 out of the province’s 93 party […]
title: John Rustad Passes BC Conservative Leadership Review With 70% Backing

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Ontario’s Ford government is pressing the federal government to bring back tougher bail and sentencing provisions as it prepares new justice reforms. Ontario’s solicitor general and attorney general sent a joint letter Sept. 22 asking the federal government to deliver substantive reforms to Canada’s federal bail and sentencing laws. “We are writing to convey Ontarians’ […]
title: Ontario Calls for ‘Three-Strikes’ Bail Rule and Return of Mandatory Minimum Sentences

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree said in a private conversation he doesn’t think municipal police forces will have the resources to enforce the Liberal government’s gun buyback program, according to a leaked audio recording. The minister had the private conversation on Sept. 21 with an individual he says he has known for “many years.” The […]
title: Leaked Audio: Public Safety Minister Expressed Doubts About Gun Buyback in Private Conversation

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A Conservative motion calling for anyone convicted of three serious offences to be denied bail or parole failed in the House of Commons, with the Liberals, Bloc Québécois, and New Democrats voting against it. The Tory motion, introduced on Sept. 18 by Conservative MP Larry Brock, sought to prevent criminals convicted of three serious offences […]
title: Tory Motion for ‘Three Strikes’ Criminal Justice Defeated in House of Commons
